p: MDGs already recommended a plethora of purposes connected to microfinance. Most of these targets were improvable from microfinance schemes. However, a notable common mistake pursued by MDGs, past policymaking and literature were to consider microfinance programmes per-se beneficial, like manna from heaven. This outlook ignored the need for coupling financial access with main development drivers – above all schooling, food, health, infrastructure and business creation (Littlefield et al., 2003).
